JGAL

Class GAL_Crossover

  • java.lang.Object
    • JGAL.GAL_GeneticOperator
      • JGAL.GAL_Crossover
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GAL_ClassicCrossover, GAL_MultiPointCrossover, GAL_RandomCrossover, GAL_SegmentCrossover, GAL_UniformCrossover

    public abstract class GAL_Crossover
extends GAL_GeneticOperator
    The GAL_Crossover is an abstract class wich extends from the GAL_GeneticOperator and haves auxiliar methods normaly used by the crossover operators.

    The crossover operators are made between pairs of chromosomes and generate new pairs of chromosomes.

    Subclasses of GAL_Crossover must provide methods for applyOperator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GAL_Crossover

        public GAL_Crossover(double prob)
        Constructs a new GAL_Crossover with a probability of ocurrence given by its only parameter.

        If the probability is out of the range [0,1], the prob will take the closest value in the range. As Example. The probability 1.5 is equal to probability 1 and the probability -1 is equal to probability 0.

        Parameters:
        prob - Probability of ocurrence for the genetic operator

    • Method Detail

      • distributeChromosomes

        protected GAL_Chromosome[][] distributeChromosomes(GAL_Chromosome[] chromosomes,
                                       double prob)
        Distributes in two groupes the chromosomes given in the first argument by the probability given in the second argument.

        If the value given by rand is less or equal to prob then the chromosome at the moment gets in the first group else it gets in the second group.

        Parameters:
        chromosomes - The chromosomes to be distributed.
        prob - The probability for the distribution.
        Returns:
        An array of arrays of GAL_Chromosome that represents the distribution.

      • groupChromosomes

        protected GAL_Chromosome[][] groupChromosomes(GAL_Chromosome[] chrom,
                                  int size)
        Creates subgroups of chromosomes which size is equal to the second parameter
        Parameters:
        chrom - The chromosomes to be divided in groups
        size - The size of each subgroup
        Returns:
        An array of arrays of GAL_Chromosome where each array of GAL_Chromosome is a subgroup.

      • correctSizeFromFirstGroup

        protected void correctSizeFromFirstGroup(GAL_Chromosome[][] chrom,
                             int n)
        Fixes the groupability of the first array in the array of arrays.

        If the first array can't be grouped into n subgroups, then the code will change the first group so it can be grouped. The elements that were removed from the first group will be concatenated at the end of the second array.

        Parameters:
        chrom - First array of chromosomes.
        n - The number at witch the first group should be subgrouped.
